column4: How can I change a launcher using gksu as sudo? used the line "gksu /usr/bin/myprog" but it doesn't do sudo
may be that's because it is not a gtk program. It's a Qt program
wht are you actually trying to run?
the ati control panel with ATI driver. It's in the menu but it hasn't permission to change /etc/X11/xorg.conf. So I must sudo it
try putting the path to the app in quotes - gksudo "/path/to/app"
No it doesn't work. the program just start directly without asking for password
did you use gksudo recently? there's a 15 min timeout IIRC
i.e. it won't ask for a password until the timeout is over
sounds more like you need root environment - hence sudo -i
Maybe that's why it can't open connection?
So I'll delete the partition for windows XP and install it in my vmware :-)
